thread.section_title: Victor Lindelof insists he wants to stay at Benfica despite Manchester United interest – Metro
thread.title: Victor Lindelof insists he wants to stay at Benfica despite Manchester United interest
thread.title_full: Victor Lindelof insists he wants to stay at Benfica despite Manchester United interest

author: Coral Barry
title: Victor Lindelof insists he wants to stay at Benfica despite Manchester United interest
text:
Victor Lindelof is rated at around £50 million (Picture: Getty) Victor Lindelof has dismissed reports suggesting Manchester United are lining up a massive summer transfer for him.
Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil The Benfica star was reportedly on the verge of a move to Old Trafford in January, but a deal never materialised.
Jose Mourinho is believed to want to return for the defender in the summer and is prepared to spend big to snare Lindelof.
United reportedly sent scouts to watch Lindelof in Benfica’s 4-0 win over Belenenses, but the Swede insisted he is happy at his current club.
‘Much has been written but it’s nothing I have focused on,’ he told Expressen.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
‘I have always focused on what was important to me and it’s club football.
‘There is no difference for me.
Lindelof has linked up with his international side this week (Picture: Getty) ‘As I said I thrive in Benfica and that’s where the focus has been.
‘A lot has been written but I’ve said nothing.’
Lindelof signed a new four-and-half-year deal earlier this month to throw a spanner in the works of Mourinho’s pursuit of the defender.
Jose Mourinho tried to sign Lindelof in January (Picture: Getty) More: Football Jose Mourinho wants Chelsea star and Tottenham ace with £25m release clause at Man Utd 
Chelsea on alert as Arsenal put Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil up for sale 
Arsene Wenger breaks silence over reports of PSG's contract offer 
The centre-back reportedly has a £50 million release clause, but revealed why he decided to sign a new contract.
‘Because it felt good. I enjoy the club and feel I evolve every day,’ he said.
‘It was an easy choice. Both parties were very happy.’
MORE: Manchester United shortlist Toby Alderweireld and Willian ahead of transfer window
